definition.value: CTS_Transport (root element)

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

requirements.value: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

definition.value: New value of the changed item (can be uniquely identified through its blockindex, groupindex and itemid).

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unit if value is a numerical value.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Certain item may specify a multiple / single choice list in a so-called catalog. Indicate if the user manually specified a value "other" than provided by the predefined list.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Predefined value for an item.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Reason why an "Edit Check" in the CTS was overruled by a user.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: An integer with a value that is not negative (e.g. >= 0)

comment.value: 32 bit number; for values larger than this, use decimal

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unique id within one instance of the CTS_Transport instance. Identifies a single operation.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Type of executed operation.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: URL to ClinicalSite.org, used as an identifier for the user responsible for the operation.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Timestamp indicating when the operation was executed by the user within a trial form.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: ID of the CRF page on which the operation was executed.

comment.value: Note that FHIR strings SHALL NOT exceed 1MB in size

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: CTS_Transport (root element)
Version of the CTS_Transport format.
ID of the patient for which a certain trial form was entered into the CTS.
URI identifing the source system. Freely definable in config.php, see "APP_PUBLICURL"
All information regarding a single change ("operation") that was executed by a user of the CTS within a single trial form.
Workflow status before the operation was executed. May be used for plausibility checking of the (new) workflow status.
Updated workflow status of the trial form.
Metadata concerning the executed operation ("statechange")
Timestamp of workflow change "not in house" -> "in house"
Indication if the changes to a trial form have been valiated by a trial monitoring team.
Indication if the changes to a trial form have been valiated by a medical review team.
Indication if certain (medical) queries are open with regard to a items defined on the current trial form.
Structured data of all fields that were changed during the executed operation.
Index of the CRF block of the item that was changed during the operation.
Index of the group of the item that was changed during the operation.
Unique name of the item that was changed during the described operation.
Metadata and the actual values of the CRF item that was changed during the described operation.
New value of the changed item (can be uniquely identified through its blockindex, groupindex and itemid).
Unit if value is a numerical value.
Certain item may specify a multiple / single choice list in a so-called catalog. Indicate if the user manually specified a value "other" than provided by the predefined list.
Predefined value for an item.
Reason why an "Edit Check" in the CTS was overruled by a user.
Unique id within one instance of the CTS_Transport instance. Identifies a single operation.
Type of executed operation.
URL to ClinicalSite.org, used as an identifier for the user responsible for the operation.
Timestamp indicating when the operation was executed by the user within a trial form.
ID of the CRF page on which the operation was executed.
